subprocess_flow.description: The Release Train Engineer (RTE) schedules the Inspect and Adapt (I&A) workshop, ensuring all relevant stakeholders are invited, including representatives from each team, product management, system architects, and business owners. The RTE also prepares the agenda, ensuring it covers the demonstration of the current solution, data review, problem-solving workshop, and identification of improvement items. Finally, the RTE ensures the necessary tools and materials are available, such as collaboration platforms, whiteboards, and data reports.
subprocess_flow.purpose: To ensure the I&A workshop is well-organized and productive.

step_risks_and_controls.control: Send reminders and emphasize the importance of the workshop

subprocess_flow.description: The System Team, along with representatives from the development teams, demonstrates the current state of the solution to all stakeholders. This demonstration should cover all key features and functionalities delivered during the PI, highlighting any significant achievements or challenges encountered. The demonstration should be interactive, allowing stakeholders to ask questions and provide feedback on the solution's performance and usability. The System Architect provides context on architectural decisions.
subprocess_flow.purpose: To provide stakeholders with a clear understanding of the current state of the solution.

step_risks_and_controls.control: Prepare backup plans and dry runs

subprocess_flow.description: The RTE presents data related to the PI's performance, including metrics such as program predictability, team velocity, defect density, and release frequency. This data should be presented in a clear and concise manner, highlighting any trends or areas of concern. The RTE facilitates a discussion around the data, encouraging stakeholders to share their insights and perspectives on the PI's performance. The RTE also presents data on dependencies and risks encountered during the PI.
subprocess_flow.purpose: To provide stakeholders with a data-driven understanding of the PI's performance.

subprocess_flow.description: Facilitated by the RTE, stakeholders participate in a structured problem-solving workshop to identify the root causes of any issues or challenges encountered during the PI. This workshop should follow a defined process, such as the 5 Whys or Fishbone diagram, to ensure a thorough analysis. The workshop should be collaborative, encouraging all stakeholders to contribute their ideas and perspectives. The System Architect provides technical insights.
subprocess_flow.purpose: To identify the root causes of issues and generate potential solutions.

step_risks_and_controls.control: Encourage active participation and create a safe environment

subprocess_flow.description: Based on the identified root causes and potential solutions, stakeholders identify specific improvement items that can be implemented in the next PI. These improvement items should be actionable, measurable, achievable, relevant, and time-bound (SMART). The improvement items should be prioritized based on their potential impact and feasibility. The RTE ensures that the improvement items are documented and assigned to responsible parties.
subprocess_flow.purpose: To identify and prioritize actionable improvement items for the next PI.

subprocess_flow.description: The RTE compiles all identified improvement items into a comprehensive improvement plan. This plan should include a description of each improvement item, the responsible party, the expected benefits, and the timeline for implementation. The improvement plan should be communicated to all stakeholders and incorporated into the next PI Planning session. The RTE tracks the progress of the improvement plan and reports on its effectiveness.
subprocess_flow.purpose: To create a roadmap for implementing the identified improvement items.

step_risks_and_controls.control: Track progress and report on effectiveness
